news_header: A newly discovered fungus, Gibellula attenboroughii, transforms cave spiders into zombies, compelling them to expose themselves for spore dispersal.
news_original_title: A fungus named after Sir David Attenborough zombifies cave spiders
news_text: Researchers have identified a new fungus named Gibellula attenboroughii, which infects cave spiders and alters their behavior, forcing them to move to exposed areas. This fungus, first observed in Northern Ireland, consumes the spider's internal organs and leads to the emergence of spore-producing structures. The study highlights the unique ecological role of this fungus and its potential implications for pest control and medical innovations.
